summary: This document is a chain of emails between FBI agents and other officials (NYPD, USMS, US Attorney's Office) coordinating logistics for witness transport and security for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial on November 29, 2021. It details meeting times, witness identities by number, entry protocols, and weapon restrictions.

persons.name: Special Agent J.
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, coordinating witness transport logistics for the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Supervisor
persons.context: Day tour CSO United States Marshal supervisor with overall supervisory responsibility for the Maxwell trial, providing contact information.

persons.name: Deputy United States Marshal
persons.context: Contact for issues regarding transporting witnesses over the bridge between buildings for the Maxwell trial.

connections.description: Coordinating security and witness transport protocols for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial between FBI and US Marshals Service.
Direct communication regarding logistics for transporting witnesses over the bridge to the courthouse for the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Maxwell Trial Day Logistics
events.description: Coordination for witness transport, security screening, and courtroom access for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. Specific witnesses are scheduled, and strict protocols (no weapons, no electronic devices) are in place.

keyFacts: The emails detail meticulous planning for witness transport and security for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial on November 29, 2021.
Witnesses are referred to by number (Witness #1, Witness #2) and have specific schedules and escort requirements.
Strict security protocols are emphasized: agents are prohibited from carrying weapons into the courthouse, and witnesses cannot have electronic devices.
Coordination involves multiple agencies: FBI, NYPD, U.S. Marshals Service, and the U.S. Attorney's Office.
